posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Wizard 37/Cleric 1/Rogue 2 - I know, it looks a bit strange.

This character can create wands and potions, scribe scrolls, has Animal Domain for better Summons (esp. on WoG), has 2 levels of Rogue for UMD, Tumble, and Evasion (and a bit of sneak, should she need it).

On WoG, creating wands, potions, or scrolls for Clerics is meh - this will demonstrate why :

https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/worldof ... view=print

Best leave those, and concentrate on Wizard spells - the Arcane.

My character on WoG, Shia Ders, is basically this - a Merchant.  She rarely adventures anymore, only to get the XP she needs to create wands and scrolls (she is never asked for potions, and I think on WoG, most don't ask for potions because they are readily available).

Wands are another thing, and so are scrolls (esp Mord's, etc).  She also deals in Dweomerstones and Sequencers (where the power REALLY is).

If interested, I can break down her stats and build by level.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, some of the good cleric spells like Divine Favor and Divine Power, as well as Darkflame, are horribly reduced in level - so the duration and damage is not that good.

For example :              Caster Level
Darkfire                                    5
Divine Favor                            5
Divine Power                           7

Those are really not very good values IMO - Certainly not worth taking all those Cleric levels - one can basically get scrolls and wands of such from Merchants ingame.

There are a few spells that are good, of course.  But I just don't see it being worth being a crafter for Cleric stuff on WoG - even Bless and Aid are only Caster level 2, and 3.  And Magic Vestment is limited to 5, as is Shield of Faith.

So is it really worth all the Cleric levels, for some Hammer of the Gods at 20?  Some Healing at level 15?  Implosion at 17?

YMMV.
